# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width = 10)
    lines = String[]
    current_line = ""

    for word in split(text, r"\s+"))
        if endof(current_line) + sizeof(word) > text_width
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = word * " "
        else
            current_line *= " " * word
        end
    end

    push!(lines, current_line)

    return join(lines, "\n")
end

# Example usage:
text = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Sed non risus. Suspendisse lectus tortor, dignissim sit amet, ultricies sed, mi. Cras nec ante."
wrapped_text = wrap_string(text)
println(wrapped_text)
```
This example defines the `wrap_string` function that takes a text and wraps it to fit within a specified width. The example usage demonstrates how to use the function with a sample text.
